2410.08769.title: Efficient Multi-Object Tracking on Edge Devices via Reconstruction-Based Channel Pruning
2410.08769.paper_summary:
The advancement of multi-object tracking (MOT) technologies presents the dual
challenge of maintaining high performance while addressing critical security
and privacy concerns. In applications such as pedestrian tracking, where
sensitive personal data is involved, the potential for privacy violations and
data misuse becomes a significant issue if data is transmitted to external
servers. To mitigate these risks, processing data directly on an edge device,
such as a smart camera, has emerged as a viable solution. Edge computing
ensures that sensitive information remains local, thereby aligning with
stringent privacy principles and significantly reducing network latency.
However, the implementation of MOT on edge devices is not without its
challenges. Edge devices typically possess limited computational resources,
necessitating the development of highly optimized algorithms capable of
delivering real-time performance under these constraints. The disparity between
the computational requirements of state-of-the-art MOT algorithms and the
capabilities of edge devices emphasizes a significant obstacle. To address
these challenges, we propose a neural network pruning method specifically
tailored to compress complex networks, such as those used in modern MOT
systems. This approach optimizes MOT performance by ensuring high accuracy and
efficiency within the constraints of limited edge devices, such as NVIDIA's
Jetson Orin Nano. By applying our pruning method, we achieve model size
reductions of up to 70% while maintaining a high level of accuracy and further
improving performance on the Jetson Orin Nano, demonstrating the effectiveness
of our approach for edge computing applications.
2410.08769.paper_summary_zh: 多目標追蹤 (MOT) 技術的進步帶來了雙重挑戰，既要維持高性能，又要解決關鍵的安全和隱私問題。在涉及敏感個人數據的行人追蹤等應用中，如果數據傳輸到外部伺服器，隱私遭侵犯和數據遭濫用的可能性將成為一個重大問題。為了減輕這些風險，直接在邊緣裝置（例如智慧型相機）上處理數據已成為一個可行的解決方案。邊緣運算確保敏感資訊保持在本地，從而符合嚴格的隱私原則並顯著降低網路延遲。然而，在邊緣裝置上實施 MOT 也有其挑戰。邊緣裝置通常具有有限的運算資源，因此需要開發高度最佳化的演算法，以便在這些限制下提供即時效能。最先進的 MOT 演算法的運算需求與邊緣裝置的效能之間的差異突顯了一個重大的障礙。為了應對這些挑戰，我們提出了一種神經網路修剪方法，專門用於壓縮複雜網路，例如用於現代 MOT 系統的網路。這種方法透過確保在 NVIDIA 的 Jetson Orin Nano 等有限邊緣裝置的限制內具備高準確度和效率，來最佳化 MOT 效能。透過應用我們的修剪方法，我們實現了高達 70% 的模型大小縮減，同時維持高準確度，並進一步提升 Jetson Orin Nano 的效能，證明了我們的方法對邊緣運算應用的有效性。
2410.08769.author: Jan Müller et.al.
